newsitem.title: UK: Hyder "outraged" at Ofwat underspend list.
newsitem.headline: Hyder "outraged" at Ofwat underspend list.

text.p: Welsh water and sewerage company Hyder Plc is "outraged" that it appears to be included among companies which watchdog Ofwat regards as under-investing, head of water services Brian Charles said on Thursday.
"I am outraged by the Ofwat statement," Charles said in a telephone interview with Reuters.

The dispute arises from a statement issued by Ofwat earlier on Thursday which detailed rebates and price limits volunteered by companies in an attack on those that had fallen short of investment targets.
The list included Hyder, which had agreed to cap price increases half a percentage point below limits set by Ofwat for 1997-98.
But Charles said the cut was not connected with under-investment and that Hyder would actually exceed its spending target during the current year.
"We will be spending 250 million pounds this year compared with our profile spend of 190 million," he said.
Charles added that last year, however, Hyder spent 219 million pounds compared with a target of 250 million pounds.
It trimmed price increases by half a point in the period.
Ofwat sets price increase limits related to inflation and based on a profile of spending over a five year period.
